oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pharmacokinetics of Parenteral Vitamin E in Peripartum Dairy Cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bankert, M.
LeBlanc, S. J.
Leslie, K. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: parenteral vitamin E
placenta
metritis
subcutaneous injection
intramuscular injection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Supplementation of peripartum dairy cattle with parenteral vitamin E has been reported to decrease the incidence of retained placenta and metritis. Our objective was to compare the effect of one subcutaneous (SC) or intramuscular (IM) injection of vitamin E on plasma and neutrophil a-tocopherol concentrations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2004; 214-215
